com.google.appinventor.components.runtime
Class Player

java.lang.Object
  com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.AndroidNonvisibleComponent
      com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
MediaPlayer.OnCompletionListener, Component, Deleteable, OnDestroyListener
public final class Player
extends AndroidNonvisibleComponent
implements Component, MediaPlayer.OnCompletionListener, OnDestroyListener, Deleteable

Multimedia component that plays audio or video and optionally vibrates. It is built on top of MediaPlayer.

Author:
halabelson@google.com (Hal Abelson)

Method Detail

Source

public String Source()
Returns the path to the audio or video source

Source

public void Source(String path)
Sets the audio or video source.

See MediaUtil.determineMediaSource(com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.Form, java.lang.String) for information about what a path can be.

Parameters:
path - the path to the audio or video source

IsPlaying

public boolean IsPlaying()
Reports whether the media is playing.

IsLooping

public boolean IsLooping()
Reports whether the media is looping.

IsLooping

public void IsLooping(boolean looping)
Sets the looping property to true or false.

Parameters:
looping - tells if the media should be looping

Volume

public void Volume(int vol)
Sets the volume property to a number between 0 and 100.

Parameters:
vol - the desired volume level

Start

public void Start()
Plays the media. If it was previously paused, the playing is resumed. If it was previously stopped, it starts from the beginning.

Pause

public void Pause()
Suspends playing the media if it is playing.

Stop

public void Stop()
Stops playing the media and seeks to the beginning of the song.

Vibrate

public void Vibrate(long milliseconds)
Vibrates for specified number of milliseconds.

PlayerError

public void PlayerError(String message)
